frontend_hideDonateButtonsInPopupDescrip.message: No es que no quiera que obtenga Talkie üåü Premium o done para apoyar Talkie y el desarrollo de c√≥digo abierto en general. Los botones siempre estar√°n disponibles aqu√≠ entre las opciones, por si acaso.
frontend_hideDonateButtonsInPopupDescrip.original: It's not like I don't want you to get Talkie üåü Premium or donate to support Talkie and open source development in general ‚Äî I just don't want you to be annoyed when using Talkie in the first place. If you disable the donation buttons in the popup, I hope that you will also support Talkie in some way! The buttons will always be available here among the options, just in case.

frontend_hideDonateButtonsInPopupHeading.message: Donar: apoyar el desarrollo de c√≥digo abierto

frontend_licenseCLADescription.message: Todas las contribuciones a Talkie se realizan bajo el Acuerdo de Licencia de Colaborador (CLA).
frontend_licenseCLADescription.original: All contributions to Talkie are made under the Contributor License Agreement (CLA).

frontend_storyDescription.message: Talkie fue desarrollado unos d√≠as antes del A√±o Nuevo 2016/2017, en un desaf√≠o de un amigo. El reto se inici√≥ con la pregunta: mientras se trabaja para trabajar, ¬øes posible escuchar un art√≠culo en lugar de leerlo? F√°cil, le dije, y me dispuse a demostrarlo, o al menos a hacer que mi navegador hablara el texto usando una voz de computadora tonta. La versi√≥n b√°sica, sin ninguna interfaz de usuario, result√≥ ser trivial para crear. A√±adir una interfaz de usuario, tard√≥ un poco m√°s. Adici√≥n de detecci√≥n de idioma adecuado un mont√≥n m√°s c√≥digo. Superar los errores en el navegador a√∫n m√°s trabajo. La lista de mejoras y caracter√≠sticas contin√∫a ‚Äî y unas pocas miles de l√≠neas de c√≥digo m√°s tarde, est√° buscando el resultado final.
frontend_storyDescription.original: Talkie was developed a few days before the New Year 2016/2017, on a challenge from a friend. The challenge started with the question: while commuting to work, is it possible to listen to an article instead of reading it? Easy, I said, and set out to prove it ‚Äî or at least to make my browser speak out text using a silly computer voice. The basic version, without any user interface, turned out to be trivial to create. Adding a user interface, took a bit longer. Adding proper language detection a bunch more code. Overcoming bugs in the browser even more work. The list of improvements and features goes on ‚Äî and a few thousand lines of code later, you're looking at the end result.

frontend_storyThankYou.original: Thank you for using Talkie ‚Äî if you like it, tell your friends!

notAbleToSpeakTextFromThisSpecialTab.message: Talkie no puede acceder al texto Talkie de este tipo de p√°gina. Es una p√°gina muy especial, y hay limitaciones de seguridad introducidas por el navegador. Tambi√©n puede intentar Talkie texto, luego haga clic derecho en √©l y elija Talkie en el men√∫. notAbleToSpeakTextFromThisSpecialTab.original: Talkie cannot access the selected text from this type of page. It is a very special page, and there are security limitations put in by the browser. You can also try to select text, then right click on it, and choose Talkie in the menu. I'm sorry for the inconvenience.
